project.title: Serpent Cult- Idols
project.description:
A second exploration for the Cult of Serpents. Massive gold idols are made to represent the serpent gods, with sacrifices of gold strewn about the area. The prophets and priests of this cult have their bodies embalmed upon death and used as a set of stairs for the holy towers. The bones and skin of the serpents are left in place and used as alternate methods of transportation.
More on my IG! @fmacmanus

project.title: Nasa x National Geographic - MARS
project.description:
Hi everyone, here is the work I've done for National Geographic and Nasa for a major Mars project envisioning how Mars could look long time ago with the water theory. It would start as an Icy sand planet, then the water came from melting. The red tone we can see in the presents days is mainly because of the iron presence in the sand. I was also commissioned to create the animation showcasing how the Rover is gathering the sample and send it back to earth.



It was once again a great honor and an amazing experience to work with the various scientists and geologists from various fields.



Credit :
NASA/JPL-Caltech, NASA, National Geographic, Manuel Canales, Monica Serrano, Kennedy Elliott, Eve Conant, Matthew W. Chwastyk 
NGM Staff; Research: Patricia Healy and Alexander Stegmaier
Art, Textures and Animation: Antoine Collignon
3D Model: Ronald Paniagua

project.title: Parquet - Megascans Scan Remake
project.description:
With this piece I tried to recreate a Megascans surface, mainly aiming to achieve as much photorealism as possible.
In my examples, I've included Parquet patterns such as: Herringbone, Chevron, Versailles, Checkerboard and d'Aremberg.
Everything was done in Substance Designer, except for some the assets from Megascans in the scene render.

project.title: Mech Hangar - TAC-8
project.description:
The TAC-8 mechas are multifunctional, they are most of the time used as a machine to tow or carry, endowed with a simple artificial intelligence but very easily modifiable. These mechas can accomplish simple tasks such as transport or tow things, their mass production makes them a standard in the mecha industry, their bodies and accessories are very easily modifiable, findable and inexpensive due to mass production. 
A short training of a month is enough for someone to know how to maintenance it. 
The biggest customers interested in the TAC-8 technology are the agricultural, transport and military giants.

Sketch and final sculpt in Medium, rendered in blender, final overpaint in Photoshop.

project.title: PBSC - Sons of Ada #2 CADET
project.description:
PBSC - Private Security Belt Contractors
.
Solar System. Year 2366.
Human civilization expanded across the boundaries over Mras and settled new colonies on the Main Belt.
With time, the most prominent political figures among the Beltian Sectors claimed independence and freedom from the Human Government on Earth, causing turmoils and civil warfares.
In this lawless far-west-like scenario, PBSC factions arose throughout the Beltian Sectors, willing to operate for the highest bidder among the powerful multinationals controlling the society.
Sons Of Ada is one of the most poweful and renowned PBSC factions, operating for the richest multinationals in the Beltian Sectors. Under the leadership of their capable, fascinating and yet intimidating commander, High Priestess Ada, they work to maintain security and peace throughout the largest multinational‚Äôs territories‚Ä¶ as long as they get paid enough, of course.

project.title: A Tribute to Halo - UE4
project.description:
I'm really happy to be calling this one done after working on it the past few months. Like all my projects it started off small, was only supposed to be 1-2 still images. And of course it grew in scope and ended up being 30+ seconds of animated footage. *sigh*
Fully rendered in Unreal Engine 4. 
RTX 2060 Super.
Base Model by Kristian Berget.  Final model optimization, extra details, UV's, texturing, done by me.  Art direction, environment art, lighting, rendering, editing, done by me.  Music by Epidemic Sound.

project.title: Black Myth: Wukong's teaser for Chinese new year
project.description:
Yesterday was the last day before the Spring Festival. I paid respects to my colleagues who came home from work, and then turned off the power. This year's time is very fast, and it's not easy. Everyone seems to have become a soldier in the peaceful era. Towards the end of the year, we decided to work overtime, cut some clips in the development into short films, and give a brief report to the players who care about us. It's also a little blessing for the year of Xin Chou. I wish you all strong as cattle in the new year
  Thanks all for the joint efforts. You are amazing. The characters and scene props come from 3D artists in the level group, outsourcing partners, and megascans.
  The scene in the video comes from the real level in the game, I hope you like it.

I used ZBrush to sculpt and Maya V-Ray to render.

platform: Old Man of the Fire - Itch.io

project.title: Hope
project.description:
Last year I saw a lot of darkness. I'm sure we all did.. Personally I dealt with being screwed over by people I used to trust, being forced to travel during a pandemic, and just trying to keep a clear head in general during all the chaos. It really pushed my limit. Amidst all the madness there was a lot of light and kindness as well; I met some of the greatest and coolest people I've ever known, landed an amazing new job where I'm inspired on a daily basis, became more in tune with myself and grew happier in many ways.

Looking back I can say that I'm incredibly grateful for everything that happened in my life the past year. The good and the bad.

This piece is a reminder for myself and perhaps others too, that even in the darkest times you always have to keep a little light in your thoughts. Stay cheerful, positive, be kind to others. Keep calm and don't let the negative thoughts lead you astray. Especially in times like these. I have hope that things will be better.

This project started as a horse study under the guidance of Krystal Sae Eua around July of last year and ended up turning into a lot more. She was incredibly helpful and really pushed my understanding of art in general. She's a great artist and a very kind person. I can only recommend her mentorship.
Here's her site:
https://www.artstation.com/iamsadpanda
Her workshop:
https://thementorcoalition.com/creature-art-mentorship

Rendered with Arnold GPU, sculpted in ZBrush.

Thanks for looking and reading if you did : ) !

project.title: Lego Study
project.description: Yeah, boring times during all the covid-19 days. During early 2020 (first lockdown) I spent 3 days with kids sorting out lego bricks by colors. We put together all of those beautiful transparent pieces aside and I made some pictures which inspired me to make some 3d version. I used redshift for rendering.. I have 2 GPUs (2080 and Titan). Rendering was pure hell‚Ä¶ all those refractions, caustics and dust‚Ä¶ tried other rendereres but none of them was even close to what I was able to achieve with Redshift.

Museum - Final Project for Intro to 3D at Gnomon.

The assignment was to create an interior in Maya based on concept art. I had a great time working on this environment and was able to experiment with multiple new tools like MASH and diving deeper into Hypershade.

Modeled in Maya. Statue sculpted in ZBrush. Textures are a mix of Substance Designer, Painter, and Megascans. Rendered in V-Ray.

The beautiful, original concept by Rado Markovic

https://www.artstation.com/artwork/8y5JO

project.title: UE4: Realtime fur test on RTX 3080
project.description:
Quick test I've made to see how easy is to set up real-time fur in UE4 with Ray Tracing on. I've made a model and bust groom in Maya last year, but everything else, the rest of the body groom, basic rig and skin, few blend shapes for the head, simple animation, and Unreal scene, was made in a day for the sake of this test, so this is nowhere near finished Environment assets, "Tropical Jungle Pack" by PolyAsset3D
There is around 600k hairs that are running in real-time on RTX 3080 and AMD Ryzen 9 5900X with 64gb RAM, although I've got similar numbers with RTX 3080 and i7-2600K overclocked to 4.4GHz with 16gb RAM but with significant frame drops. I've imported Maya XGen alembic files without optimization and I think that framerate could be much higher if I did. Adding a bunch of assets didn't help ether
The process of setting up Groom Assets is not too complicated but there are a few things that require a bit of planning, especially if you work with XGen and need textured hair. There is a problem with DOF and groom ( there are artefacts around edges ) but as this is still a Beta I hope that would be solved in the future.
*Note: Groom physics simulation is not enabled because his fur is short.

project.title: Frozen Dawn [UE4 Real-time]
project.description:
Living in the cloudy city like Saint-P and seeing sun for brief moments from time to time, you sometimes find yourself wondering how would it feel to observe the clear shiny dawn for once in a while.
--
This is my first organic environment. It based on stunning CGMA Organic World Building in UE4 course by Anthony Vaccaro. During working on this project I realized, how fascinating are procedural texturing process and technical aspect of shader art. That is why I was mostly focusing on materials and UE4 shaders creation this time.

Every assets was made by myself, modelled in Maya or sculpted in ZBrush. For texturing I was using Zbrush (chunky cliff), Substance Designer (snow and ice), Substance Painter (megascan canopy atlas adjustments) and Substance Alchemist (pine bark photoscan adjustments). Everything was put together in UE4 4.24.

P.S. Also I want to make a breakdown post about shaders, so stay tuned!

project.title: [UE4] Green - Interior Environment
project.description:
'Green' is a UE4 interior environment I made in my spare time during the new year breaks, to push myself in making realistic render with real-time engine. I don't have a beast PC so no ray-tracing and expensive lightmap, had to fake certain details.

It's inspired by a photo I saw on Pinterest, I was in love with the colour and composition-- and decided to create something based on it.
First off, I wanted something that feels 'Zen-y'. Then I want to turn this space into a more 'lived-in' looking place. I believe in the power of storytelling -- and I want people to be able to imagine there was someone lying down on the couch, chilling and reading just a moment ago.

I created/modified most props and lighted this scene myself, though some amazing props are found elsewhere. Special thanks to the DiNusty and Ngorns community, and everyone that has given me support and feedback!

project.title: Warmth
project.description:
I had the pleasure of working with MrSuicideSheep on this project! These animated illustrations are a ton of fun to work on! The illustration was created in photoshop on top of a 3D base from Blender - hand animated the fire, steam and smoke in Procreate - snow and trees animated in After Effects, along with the overall compositing.

For more: https://www.instagram.com/gavinodonnellart/

project.title: Father / Son collaboration
project.description: My son challenged me to bring one of his drawings to life in 3D. I was hesitant because modeling characters is not what I do and getting CBB( Could Be Better ) notes from him would not be fun ü§£ü§£ü§£. But I figured it could be something cool to do /learn from and went along with it. I took some liberties but hopefully he thinks it‚Äôs ok üòÇ. Glad to start the new year off with something different for me. Happy New Year everyone!

project.title: Soul
project.description:
Visual Development Art done for Pixar's Soul.

During my time in the show, my task was mainly dedicated to synthesize and provide a visual approach for the human world. Creating a visual contrast between the Soul world and New York City.

project.title: The Christmas Tree Summoning!
project.description:
Hello ArtStation! [first post ALERT]
The Christmas Tree Summoning!
Here is my entry for #JingleBellJam ! I‚Äôve always wanted to create work for children‚Äôs stories so I tried to channel that charm within this piece. I was inspired by Dr. Seuss‚Äôs story The Lorax and I‚Äôd like to think there‚Äôs a little bit of him within my tree character!  The song lyrics ‚ÄòO Christmas Tree, O Christmas Tree how lovely are thy branches‚Äô came to me as some sort of magical charm or conjuring to summon something!
Glad I could take part in an awesome idea prompt and for it to be my first post.
Merry Christmas to all!
RobbieGoldieArt
